title: In substance, Rubio's message in Munich was the same as Vance's
subhead: While the US secretary of state struck a less aggressive tone toward Europe than the American vice president had a year earlier, the substance of the speech changed little.

title: Investigators raid offices of former French minister Jack Lang over Epstein ties
French far right points fingers at Mélenchon's LFI over death of activist in Lyon
'A drunk woman is shameful': Why women face greater risks but receive less support for alcohol addiction
subhead: Although women as a whole drink less alcohol than men, they are physiologically more vulnerable to its toxicity. Yet these increased health risks are often met with silence, violence and delays in accessing care.

title: In southern Lebanon, 'the war goes on and residents cannot return home'
subhead: Riad Al-Assaad, a civil engineer, describes the despair gripping the population of Lebanon's border region. This area, devastated by the war in fall 2024, remains under Israeli bombardment, while a US veto blocks any attempts at reconstruction.

title: 'Wuthering Heights': A 'dark romance' swept away by Margot Robbie
subhead: Emerald Fennell draws on Emily Brontë's novel to unravel a series of vignettes punctuated by erotic scenes in which the actress dominates the screen.

title: How Jeffrey Epstein built the global network that protected him
subhead: The sexual predator, who came from a modest background, used his scheming and manipulation to open the doors to the global elite. His influence was such that many powerful figures continued to associate with him, even after his first conviction in 2008.

title: German foreign minister says French defense spending insufficient
Dana Eden, Israeli producer of 'Tehran' TV series, found dead in Athens
Iran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei: The twilight of a tyrant
Investigators search for perpetrators of fatal assault of far-right activist in Lyon
'Cancer is a political issue because public authorities have the power to prevent it, yet fail to do so'
Swiss train derailment caused by avalanche injures five
US ambassador's highly undiplomatic remarks spark controversy in Poland
Paris's Grand Mosque releases guide on adapting Islam to France
Syria's Al-Hol camp emptied after mass escape of jihadist families
Epstein's African connections included presidents, heirs and recruiters
The dragon reveals its thousand incarnations at Paris's Quai Branly Museum
When game-like online brokerage becomes risky
South Korea's 'comfort women' take on the US military
subhead: For decades, thousands of South Korean women were forced into prostitution for the pleasure of American soldiers, with the support of the Seoul government. They are now seeking reparations.

title: Former French envoy to Moscow warns of a new US-Russia convergence
subhead: Confronted with hostility from both Russia and the US, Europe has been shaken by the disregard for international law, which underpins its very identity. French diplomat Pierre Lévy believes Europe must reassert its strengths.

title: How the Ivorian president's niece acted as Epstein's go-between
subhead: The Epstein files reveal the close relationship between the late financier and Nina Keita, who introduced him to young women and local business leaders. The niece of Côte d'Ivoire's president, Alassane Ouattara, now holds a senior position in Abidjan.

title: After Munich Security Conference, Europeans have a duty to unite
'With Donald Trump, the image of digital multinational companies has become re-Americanized'
'Donald Trump floods the political and media landscape, even in France, where domestic issues suddenly seem trivial'
